revisionDesc.change: Finalized - corrected and ready. I agreed on the chirho in l. 15 proposed by J. Cowey, the stauros instead seems to be a typo in CPR XIX 31,15.

Vote - AcceptText - lin2 (Στεφαν[(οῦτος)]) -> (Στεφ[αν(οῦτος)]); lin8 two slanting strokes; lin13 entry is fine as it is; lin15 I prefer *chirho* because it is in the edition in CPR VIII 60.7 and the photo in CPR VIII Tafel 30 makes the reading of chirho instead of stauros better
Vote - AcceptText - Accept. Lin8 2 slanting strokes or none (not 4)
Add dummy header for original identifier 'papyri.info/ddbdp/cpr;8;60' pointing to new identifier 'papyri.info/ddbdp/cpr;19;31'

Entered Greek text from CPR 19.31. Is reedition of CPR 8.60 (supplemented at the top with 9 subsequently found lines ). lin15--> *stauros* instead of ed.pr lin7 *chirho* not justified in appar., so typo??(have no photo at hand, can't check); lin13 don't understand appar. "l. τοῦτο" (is in text, so?)
changed schema; added xml:space=preserve; indented; moved title/@n to idno
Converted from TEI P4 (EpiDoc DTD v. 6) to P5 (EpiDoc RNG schema)
